ARABIC: وَإِذَا حَضَرَ ٱلْقِسْمَةَ أُو۟لُوا۟ ٱلْقُرْبَىٰ وَٱلْيَتَٰمَىٰ وَٱلْمَسَٰكِينُ فَٱرْزُقُوهُم مِّنْهُ وَقُولُوا۟ لَهُمْ قَوْلًا مَّعْرُوفًا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: If other relatives or orphans or poor people attend the sharing-out. provide for them out of it and speak to them correctly and courteously.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And when the relatives and orphans and the needy collect at the time of the division (of property) provide for them too, and talk kindly to them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: If other near of kin orphans and needy are pre sent at the time of division of inheritance give them some thing of it and speak to them kindly.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: If relatives, orphans or destitute people, are present at the distribution of the legacy, give them something and speak kindly to them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And if relatives and orphans and the needy are present at the time of disbursement, give them something from it and speak to them with kindness.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And when the relatives, and the orphans, and the poor are present at the time of division, give them from the property, and speak to them words of kindness and justice.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And when there are present at the division the relatives and the orphans and the needy, give them (something) out of it and speak to them kind words.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: and when the division is attended by kinsmen and orphans and the poor, make provision for them out of it, and speak to them honourable words.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And when kinsfolk and orphans and the needy are present at the division (of the heritage), bestow on them therefrom and speak kindly unto them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: If other relatives, orphans or needy people are present at the time of the division, then provide for them out of it, and speak kindly to them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And when those of kin are Present at the division and the orphans and the needy, provide for them thereout, and say unto them a reputable saying.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: And when the division is attended by relatives, the orphans and the needy, provide for them out of it, and speak to them honourable words.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: But if at the time of division other relatives, or orphans or poor, are present, feed them out of the (property), and speak to them words of kindness and justice.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And when the relatives and the orphans and Al-Masakin (the poor) are present at the time of division, give them out of the property, and speak to them words of kindness and justice.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: If relatives, orphans, or the needy are present at the division (of the inheritance), provide for them out of it, and speak to them in kind words.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: If the distribution is attended by the relatives, and the orphans, and the needy, give them something out of it, and speak to them kindly.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And when [other] relatives and orphans and the needy are present at the [time of] division, then provide for them [something] out of the estate and speak to them words of appropriate kindness.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [4:8] And when the division, of the inheritance, is attended by kinsmen, those of kinship who cannot inherit, and orphans and the poor, grant them, something, out of it, before the division [is effected]; and, if the inheritors are young, speak to them, O guardians, honourable words, kindly, by apologising to them that it is not your possession [to divide as you wish], but that it is for the young [inheritors]. Some say that this [stipulation] was abrogated; others say that it was not, only that people were all too readily neglecting it, since it was encouraged [but not prescribed]. According to Ibn ‘Abbās, however, it is a duty.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And when kinsfolk) who are not entitled to receive a share of the inheritance (and orphans) the orphans of believers before the division of the inheritance (and the needy) the needy among believers (are present at the division) of the heritage, (bestow on them there from) give them something of the inheritance before you proceed to divide it upon those who are entitled to receive it (and speak kindly unto them) if the inheritor has not yet reached the age of puberty, by promising them to speak to the inheritor about giving them something.
